title: Just got another survey
body:
And instead of actually putting comment sections in, they took out the one at the end of the survey.

Rito is fun.

replies.body: They probably got sick of hearing "stop being greedy", "do something about the ridiculous amounts of toxicity" and "balance your crappy game".

Survey.... don't want feedback....

Good old heartvine logic.

I don't think any of those three statements count as feedback. Feedback would be things like Zed feels too snowball-y, Chickens are way too strong early and so on and so forth. The examples HeartVine gave constitute complaints that have no constructive criticism that Riot could actually use.

As for why the comments section would be removed in this survey, likely they wanted information on a few specific things to work on that before seeking more generalised feedback again. Answering Yes or no or on a scale of how much you agree gives them quantifiable stats that they can use to get the best image of what the community at large feels about x, whereas comments are very individualised and not quantifiable, and that may not be the kind of information they are looking for in this particular case.

>As for why the comments section would be removed in this survey, likely they wanted information on a few specific things to work on that before seeking more generalised feedback again.

So lets start with this, the only specific thing that seemed to be added for this survey was a whole "are we banning properly" part.

>Answering Yes or no or on a scale of how much you agree gives them quantifiable stats that they can use to get the best image of what the community at large feels about x

Unless the question is entirely bullshit, and has to be answered one way unless you are being dishonest/trying to make a point (which is why i made a boards post telling them to put comments sections into each part so that their answers aren't defined by their shitty ability to make unbiased questions.)

Sure you can quantify how many beans are in a jar, but if you want to know how many are edible, you have to ask the right question.

I didn't get the survey so I was only speculating. But even for a question such as that quantifiable answers are useful. Assuming for that question you have options [Disagree] [Somewhat Disagree] [Neutral] [Somewhat Agree] [Agree], it gives you a good feel for the general opinion of the ban system. 

The intention here seems to be more "how do people feel about the systems overall" rather than looking for specific areas players feel aren't working so great, which makes sense because they have a boatload of other avenues from which they can get that kinda info, and have sent out surveys things in the past.

Yes we are given Disagree to agree as answers, but that doesn't mean the questions are useful.

It's like giving those options to "is the sky blue" in some of the actual questions they have in some of these surveys, and these aren't useful sorts of questions (And there are also a bunch of questions that tend to look like ego stroking from riot as well).

Which is why we need a comment section, because some are worded in a way that you have to give an answer one way, but realistically it would prompt a conversation towards the other way just because of how it is worded.

We're talking about Riot here.

Pretty sure Riot doesn't care for negative feedback, especially when it starts impacting their profit.
